metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1999024 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - low.
metadata.Description: MathJax version prior to version 2.7.4 contains a Cross Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the \unicode{} macro that can result in Potentially untrusted Javascript running within a web browser. This attack appear to be exploitable via The victim must view a page where untrusted content is processed using Mathjax. This vulnerability appears to have been fixed in 2.7.4 and later.

criterions.comment: mathjax package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.7.4+dfsg-1').
